{{Infobox person |name = Sam Nunberg |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1981|6|21}} |birth_place = |death_date = |death_place = |education = [[McGill University]] {{small|([[Bachelor of Arts|BA]])}}
[[Touro Law Center]] {{small|([[Juris Doctor|JD]])}} |party = [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican]] |occupation = Political consultant }} '''Sam Nunberg''' (born June 21, 1981) is an American public affairs consultant based in Manhattan.{{cite news |url=https://www.timesofisrael.com/jewish-aide-who-helped-launch-trumps-campaign-sees-him-dropping-early-positions/ |title=Jewish aide who helped launch Trump's campaign sees him dropping early positions |last=Cortellessa |first=Eric |date=September 28, 2017 |newspaper=[[The Times of Israel]] |access-date=March 6, 2018}} He was a political advisor to [[Donald Trump presidential campaign, 2016|Donald Trump's 2016 presidential campaign]]. In March 2018, Nunberg was [[subpoena|subpoenaed]] by a grand jury for testimony and documents relating to the [[Special Counsel investigation (2017–present)|Special Counsel's Russia investigation]].{{cite web |url=https://www.cnn.com/2018/03/06/politics/sam-nunberg-robert-mueller-backtracks-will-cooperate/index.html |title=Former Trump campaign aide backtracks on Mueller: 'I'm going to cooperate' |last=Diamond |first=Jeremy |date=March 6, 2018 |website=CNN |access-date=March 6, 2018}} ==Early life and education== Nunberg was born to a [[American Jews|Jewish]] family; his mother was a corporate attorney at [[Wachtell, Lipton, Rosen & Katz|Wachtell, Lipton]] and his father was a real estate attorney who worked with Trump attorney Gerald Schrager.{{cite web |last= Freedlander |first=David |title=Sam Nunberg Is Still Talking. Crazy man or chess master? 4 hours with Donald Trump's wildest adviser |website=[[Politico]] |date=March 23, 2018 |url=https://www.politico.com/magazine/story/2018/03/23/sam-nunberg-donald-trump-217697 |accessdate=November 5, 2018}} He attended the [[Ramaz School]] an independent co-educational [[Modern Orthodox Judaism|Modern Orthodox Jewish]] [[University-preparatory school|prep school]] in the [[Upper East Side]] neighborhood of [[Manhattan]]. He graduated with a BA in History from [[McGill University]] in 2004.{{cite web |url=https://www.cnn.com/2018/03/05/politics/who-is-sam-nunberg/index.html |title=Who is Sam Nunberg? |last1=Dunn |first1=Andrew |date=March 5, 2018 |website=[[CNN]] |access-date=March 5, 2018}} He attended [[Touro Law Center]] on [[Long Island]], New York, from 2007 to 2009, graduating in 2009, and was admitted to the New York state bar in 2013. {{cite web |url=https://www.npr.org/2018/03/05/591001865/ex-trump-campaign-aide-vows-to-fight-mueller-subpoena-in-tv-tirades |title=Ex-Trump Aide Sam Nunberg Now Says He Is Likely To Cooperate With Mueller Subpoena |last=Mak |first=Tim |date=March 5, 2018 |website=[[NPR]] |access-date=March 6, 2018}} ==Career== While working as a volunteer for the [[Mitt Romney presidential campaign, 2008|Mitt Romney 2008 presidential campaign]], Nunberg met and was hired by attorney [[Jay Sekulow]] to work at the [[American Center for Law & Justice]] in an attempt to stop the construction of the [[Park51|Park51 mosque]].{{cite web |website=[[Politico]] |quote=Nunberg also has ties to one of Trump's personal attorneys, Jay Sekulow, who he credits with helping him get his start in campaign politics. Nunberg was working as a volunteer for Mitt Romney's 2008 presidential campaign when he first met Sekulow, who also is the chief counsel of the non-profit American Center for Law & Justice. Sekulow hired Nunberg to work in ACLJ's New York office to help stop the construction of a mosque near the World Trade Center site. |url=https://www.politico.com/story/2018/03/05/sam-nunberg-russia-probe-subpoena-437108 |date=March 5, 2018 |first=Darren |last=Samuelsohn |title=Ex-Trump aide defies Mueller, risks jail |access-date=November 5, 2018}} While working there he met political operative [[Roger Stone]], whom he has described as his mentor and "surrogate father".{{cite web |url=https://www.esquire.com/news-politics/a19129281/sam-nunberg-meltdown/ |title=Explaining Sam Nunberg's Bonkers Trump-Russia Interviews |last=Holmes |first=Jack |date=March 6, 2018 |website=[[Esquire (magazine)|Esquire]] |access-date=March 8, 2018 |quote=[Nunberg] continually signaled his intent to protect Stone, whom he characterized at one point as something like a "surrogate father."}}{{cite web |url=http://theweek.com/speedreads/759193/sam-nunberg-says-thinks-mueller-really-focused-trumps-business |title=Sam Nunberg says he thinks Mueller is really focused on Trump's business |date=March 5, 2018 |website=[[The Week]] |access-date=March 8, 2018 |quote=Throughout the interview, Nunberg, who was fired from President Trump's campaign in 2015, called Stone "a mentor" and "like a surrogate father" to him, and said he refuses to go in front of a grand jury "for them to set up a case against Roger, whatever case it is."}}{{cite web |url=https://www.rawstory.com/2018/03/msnbcs-morning-joe-thinks-nunbergs-tv-meltdown-smokescreen-trump-roger-stone-proud/ |title=MSNBC's Morning Joe thinks Nunberg's TV meltdown is a 'smokescreen': 'Trump and Roger Stone would be proud' |last=Gettys |first=Travis |date=March 6, 2018 |website=[[The Raw Story]] |access-date=March 8, 2018 |quote=Scarborough suspected, however, that Nunberg's bizarre, and possibly alcohol-fueled, outburst was part of a setup to protect his political mentor and "surrogate father," Republican dirty trickster Roger Stone, and his old boss.}} Nunberg began working for Trump, as a consultant, in 2011,{{cite news |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/the-beatles-had-pete-best-trump-had-sam-nunberg/2018/03/06/6e778ae4-2159-11e8-94da-ebf9d112159c_story.html |title=The Beatles had Pete Best. Donald Trump had Sam Nunberg. |last=Costa |first=Robert |date=March 6, 2018 |newspaper=[[The Washington Post]] |access-date=March 11, 2018 |issn=0190-8286}}, after Trump decided not to run for president in 2012. Nunberg assisted in the writing of Trump's 2011 speech at the [[Conservative Political Action Conference]].{{cite web |url=https://forward.com/fast-forward/373481/sam-nunberg-8-things-to-know-about-the-former-trump-staffer/ |title=8 Things To Know About Once And (Maybe) Future Trump Aide Sam Nunberg |last1=Goldiner |first1=Dave |date=March 6, 2018 |website=[[The Forward]] |access-date=March 10, 2018 |last2=Boxer |first2=Jeffrey}} His other work during the period included being the director of the [[Middle East Forum]]'s Legal Project from January 2012 to November 2014.{{cite web |url=http://www.meforum.org/3125/sam-nunberg-appointed-legal-project-director |title=Sam Nunberg Appointed Legal Project's Director |date=December 12, 2011 |website=[[Middle East Forum]] |access-date=March 11, 2018}} After being hired by Trump, Nunberg told friends that the more that Trump considered a presidential run, the more consulting work for Stone and him. In February 2014 Nunberg was fired by Trump after he arranged a [[BuzzFeed]] interview that ended up being highly critical of Trump; the headline was "36 Hours on The Fake Campaign Trail with Donald Trump." In February 2015 he was rehired by Trump, as a communications adviser for the Trump campaign,{{cite news |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/trump-says-he-is-serious-about-2016-bid-is-hiring-staff-and-delaying-tv-gig/2015/02/25/4e9d3804-bd07-11e4-8668-4e7ba8439ca6_story.html |title=Trump says he is serious about 2016 bid, is hiring staff and delaying TV gig |last=Costa |first=Robert |date=2015-02-25 |newspaper=The Washington Post |access-date=March 6, 2018 |issn=0190-8286|df=mdy-all}} but was let go, shortly thereafter, by then-campaign manager [[Corey Lewandowski]]. Nunberg was rehired by the campaign in April 2015; between then and the beginning of July he was paid $15,139 by the campaign.{{cite web |url=http://www.businessinsider.com/trump-advisers-racist-facebook-posts-2015-7 |title=Sam Nunberg has a history of provocative and racial Facebook posts |last=Walker |first=Hunter |date=July 31, 2015 |website=[[Business Insider]] |access-date=March 6, 2018}} Nunberg, along with Stone, helped prepare Trump for the [[Republican Party presidential debates and forums, 2016#August 6, 2015 – Cleveland, Ohio |first Republican debate, on August 6, 2015]].{{cite news |last1=Haberman |first1=Maggie |title=Today in Politics: Donald Trump Hopes Second Debate Goes Just Like the First |url=https://www.nytimes.com/politics/first-draft/2015/09/14/for-wednesdays-debate-donald-trump-hopes-the-2nd-verse-is-just-like-the-first/ |access-date=March 5, 2018 |newspaper=[[The New York Times]] |date=September 14, 2015}} Nunberg was fired at the end of July{{cite web |url=https://www.cnn.com/2015/07/31/politics/trump-adviser-sam-nunberg-facebook-posts/index.html |title=Trump campaign fires staffer over Facebook posts |first=Jeremy |last=Diamond |authorlink=Jeremy Diamond (journalist) |date=July 31, 2015 |website=CNN |access-date=March 6, 2018}} after old Facebook posts which contained racist comments were published. In March 2016 Nunberg endorsed Senator [[Ted Cruz]] for president, saying that Trump "does not have a coherent political ideology." In July 2016 Trump sued Nunberg for $10 million, accusing Nunberg of violating a confidentiality agreement by [[News leak|leaking]] information to the ''[[New York Post]]''.{{cite web |url=https://www.cnn.com/2016/07/13/politics/donald-trump-sam-nunberg/index.html |title=Trump sues former campaign aide |last1=Lee |first1=M. J. |last2=Diamond |first2=Jeremy |date=July 13, 2016 |website=CNN |access-date=March 6, 2018}} In a legal response, Nunberg said that Trump might have illegally funneled corporate money into the campaign. Trump and Nunberg settled their legal dispute in August 2016.{{cite web |url=https://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/sam-nunberg-donald-trump-lawsuit_us_5786a9d1e4b08608d332d58d |title=Ex-Staffer Alleges Trump Misused Funds, Set Up Fake Company |last1=Wilkie |first1=Christina |last2=Date |first2=S. V. |date=July 13, 2016 |website=[[Huffington Post]] |access-date=March 5, 2018}}{{cite tweet |last=Diamond |first=Jeremy |user=JDiamond1 |number=763830673174134784 |date=August 11, 2016 |title=Trump's general counsel Alan Garten confirms: @realDonaldTrump & @NunbergSam have "amicably" settled $10 million lawsuit Trump filed in July |access-date=March 6, 2018}} ==March 2018 subpoena and media appearances== [[File:The Moment Sam Nunberg Realized He Must Comply With Bob Mueller - The Beat With Ari Melber - MSNBC.webm|thumb|right|200px|MSNBC interview with Sam Nunberg]] [[File:2657-Nunberg-Subpoena-2018-02-27.pdf|link=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:2657-Nunberg-Subpoena-2018-02-27.pdf|thumb|Attachment to Nunberg's subpoena from the [[Special Counsel investigation (2017–present)|Mueller investigation]]]] On March 5, 2018, Nunberg spoke to multiple cable news outlets and newspaper reporters without the knowledge of his attorney. He said he had been subpoened by a grand jury to testify and provide documents relating to [[Special Counsel investigation (2017–present)|Robert Mueller's Russia investigation]], including all his email exchanges with [[Donald Trump]], [[Roger Stone]], and eight other people. He insisted he did not intend to comply with the subpoena, saying "Let him (Mueller) arrest me!"{{cite web |url=https://www.cbsnews.com/news/former-trump-aide-unloads-on-mueller-subpoena-refuses-to-cooperate/ |title=Ex-Trump aide Sam Nunberg unloads on Mueller, refuses to comply with subpoena |last=Tillett |first=Emily |date=March 5, 2018 |website=[[CBS News]] |access-date=March 6, 2018}}{{cite web |url=https://www.cnn.com/2018/03/05/politics/sam-nunberg-white-house/index.html |title=Bewildered White House staff watch Sam Nunberg's interviews |last1=Collins |first1=Kaitlan |last2=Liptak |first2=Kevin |date=March 6, 2018 |website=CNN |access-date=March 6, 2018}} He also had in-person interviews with ''[[CNN]]'s'' [[Jake Tapper]] and [[Erin Burnett]]{{cite web |url=https://www.cnn.com/2018/03/05/politics/sam-nunberg-robert-mueller/index.html |title=Former Trump aide says he's refusing Mueller subpoena: 'Screw that' |last=Watkins |first=Eli |date=March 5, 2018 |website=CNN |access-date=March 6, 2018}} and ''[[MSNBC]]'s'' [[Katy Tur]] and [[Ari Melber]].{{cite web |url=https://www.politico.com/media/newsletters/morning-media/2018/03/06/the-sam-nunberg-show-pitaro-to-lead-espn-ex-wsj-reporters-ordeal-new-nyt-politics-editor-001461 |title=The Sam Nunberg Show — Pitaro to lead ESPN — Ex-WSJ reporter's ordeal — New NYT politics editor |last=Calderone |first=Michael |date=March 6, 2018 |website=Politico |access-date=March 6, 2018}} He later backtracked, saying that he would cooperate fully with the subpoena, while expressing frustration at the large amount of documentation requested. On March 9, 2018 Nunberg testified before a federal grand jury for more than six hours, saying it was his, "duty as an American, whether I like it or not."{{cite web |url=https://www.politico.com/story/2018/03/10/sam-nunberg-interviews-media-mueller-russia-probe-453330 |title=Nunberg on grand jury testimony: 'Duty as an American, whether I like it or not' |first=Brent D. |last=Griffiths |date=March 10, 2018 |website=Politico |access-date=November 5, 2018}} Regarding the Mueller investigation, when asked whether he believed that the special counsel may have something on Trump, Nunberg responded, "I think they may." He added: "I think that he may have done something during the election. But I don't know that for sure."{{cite web |url=https://www.cnbc.com/2018/03/05/ex-trump-aide-nunberg-will-refuse-mueller-subpoena.html |title=Former Trump aide on Mueller probe: 'I think they may' have something on Trump |first1=Yen Nee |last1=Lee |first2=Mike |last2=Calia |first3=Kevin |last3=Breuninger |date=March 5, 2018 |website=CNBC |access-date=March 5, 2018}} He also said "I have no knowledge or involvement in Russian collusion or any other inappropriate act" and that: "Donald Trump won this election on his own. He campaigned his ass off. And there is nobody who hates him more than me."{{cite web |url=http://www.foxnews.com/politics/2018/03/05/let-him-arrest-me-trump-ex-campaign-aide-nunberg-says-will-refuse-muellers-subpoena.html |title='Let him arrest me': Trump ex-campaign aide Nunberg says he will refuse Mueller's subpoena |last=Pappas |first=Alex |date=March 5, 2018 |website=[[Fox News]] |access-date=March 5, 2018}} Regarding Trump's former foreign-policy advisor [[Carter Page]], Nunberg said that he believed that Page did collude with the Russians."{{cite magazine |url=https://www.newsweek.com/sam-nunberg-mueller-trump-russia-831465 |title=Sam Nunberg was subpoenaed by the Mueller team—then he went off the rails on live TV |last=Solis |first=Marie |date=March 5, 2018 |magazine=[[Newsweek]] |access-date=March 11, 2018}} == July 2018 indictment and media appearances == On July 13, 2018, Nunberg spoke to Ari Melber who asked Nunberg, "People in politics say we knew there was hacking, but the man you used to work for, Donald Trump, and many people around him doubt about how it happened, whether it mattered. Do you think today's indictment, which Donald Trump was briefed on, should change his mind about undermining both the fact that the Russians did this and attacking the probe?" Nunberg replies with, "First of all I think this should change the mind of any Republican voter that doesn't want Donald Trump to be impeached."{{cite web |url=https://www.msnbc.com/the-beat-with-ari-melber/watch/sam-nunberg-speaks-out-as-mueller-circles-mentor-roger-stone-1276735555638 |title=Sam Nunberg speaks out as Mueller circles mentor Roger Stone |first=Ari |last=Melber |website=NBC News |access-date=July 15, 2018}} {{-}} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Nunberg, Sam}} [[Category:1981 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Trump administration personnel]] [[Category:Donald Trump presidential campaign, 2016]] [[Category:People associated with the United States presidential election, 2016]] [[Category:Place of birth missing (living people)]] [[Category:McGill University alumni]] [[Category:Touro Law Center alumni]] [[Category:New York (state) Republicans]]

{{Infobox event | title = Take Our Kids to Work Day | image = | image_size = | caption = | date = November 14, 2018 | time = | type = Education | theme = | venue = | location = Canada | coordinates = | organisers = | participants = | website = http://www.thelearningpartnership.ca/TOKW }} '''Take Our Kids to Work Day''' is an annual career exploration event, held every November, where Grade 9, Senior 1 ([[Manitoba]]) and Secondary III ([[Quebec]]) students across [[Canada]] spend the day in the life of a working professional. <ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/new-brunswick/take-our-kids-work-battah-1.3299485|title=Take Our Kids to Work Day benefits students and employers {{!}} CBC News|work=CBC|access-date=2018-07-13|language=en-US}}</ref> Developed by The Learning Partnership, the initiative started as a one-day event for students in the [[Greater Toronto Area]] in the Canadian province of [[Ontario]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thelearningpartnership.ca/press/celebrating-the-take-our-kids-to-worktm-generation|title=Celebrating the Take Our Kids to Work™ Generation|website=The Learning Partnership}}</ref> Currently, it is a national event with more than 250,000 students, 18,000 teachers and 75,000 organizations participating each year.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thelearningpartnership.ca/tokw-media-room|title=Take Our Kids to Work Celebrates 20 years!|website=The Learning Partnership}}</ref> Although the event regularly takes place on the first Wednesday of November each year, the next Take Our Kids to Work Day will take place on Wednesday, November 14, 2018 due to a conflict with a major ethnic festival on the 7th. <ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.thelearningpartnership.ca/TOKW|title=Take Our Kids to Work Day {{!}} Public Education. Canada’s Future|website=www.thelearningpartnership.ca|language=en|access-date=2018-07-13}}</ref>
Students spend the day at the workplace of a parent, relative, friend or volunteer host, witnessing first-hand the world of work, prompting early career planning, and enabling students to make informed decisions about their future goals and endeavours. The event also gives parents the opportunity to discuss career prospects with their children, and allows businesses to share knowledge, experience and advice around education, career choices and relevant skills required in today’s workplace.
==Overview==
Developed by The Learning Partnership, Take Our Kids to Work Day is the most recognized career exploration event in Canada, in which Grade 9 students experience a day in the life of various professionals, careers and industries.
==History== The Learning Partnership founded Take Our Kids to Work Day in 1994. The concept of Take our Kids to Work Day was loosely related to Take Your Daughter to Work Day in the United States founded the year prior, which is now called [[Take Our Daughters and Sons to Work Day]]. Take Our Kids to Work is The Learning Partnership's flagship program. Unlike its American counterpart, Take Our Kids to Work focuses on Grade 9 students and takes place annually on the first Wednesday of November instead of April.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Criger|first1=Erin|title=Wednesday is Take Our Kids to Work day|url=http://www.citynews.ca/2013/11/06/wednesday-is-take-our-kids-to-work-day-3/|website=CityNews Toronto|publisher=Rogers Media|accessdate=9 October 2014}}</ref> November 5, 2014, marked the 20th anniversary of Take Out Kids to Work.<ref>{{cite web|title=Celebrating The Take Our Kids To Work(TM) Generation|url=https://www.theglobeandmail.com/globe-investor/news-sources/?mid=ccnm.20141007.11G023311-001|accessdate=28 October 2014}}</ref>
==See also== *[[Job shadow]] *[[Take Our Daughters And Sons To Work Day]]

Teatro Renacimiento

Teatro Mexicano | alternate_names = | image = | caption = | map_type = | altitude = | building_type = | architectural_style = [[Second Empire architecture]]
[[Napoleon III style]] (interior) | structural_system = | cost = | ren_cost = | location = | address = Donceles Street # 24, [[Centro Histórico de la Ciudad de México]] | client = | owner = [[Irma Serrano]] | current_tenants = | landlord = | coordinates = {{coord|19.4369|-99.1387|type:landmark_region:MX|display=inline,title}} | start_date = 1 Jan 1899 | completion_date = | inauguration_date = 1899 | renovation_date = 1973 | demolition_date = | destruction_date = | height = | diameter = | other_dimensions = | floor_count = | floor_area = | main_contractor = | architect = | architecture_firm = | structural_engineer = | services_engineer = | civil_engineer = | other_designers = | quantity_surveyor = | awards = | ren_architect = | ren_firm = | ren_str_engineer = | ren_serv_engineer = | ren_civ_engineer = | ren_oth_designers = | ren_qty_surveyor = | ren_awards = | references = }} The '''''Teatro Fru Fru (Fru Fru Theater)''''' is a theater in [[Mexico City]]. It was inaugurated on January 1, 1899 under the name Teatro Renacimiento. In 1973 it was re-inaugurated with its current name. It is located at number 24 in the Donceles Street, in the [[Centro Histórico de la Ciudad de México]] ==History== In the place where the theater is located was originally located the Gran Teatro Nacional.[http://www.actualmx.com/el-teatro-fru-fru/ ''Actualmx.com: The Teatro Fru Fru''] When it was demolished, the Teatro Renacimiento was built in its place.[https://www.maspormas.com/2017/02/24/la-cdmx-tiempo-los-teatros/ ''Máspormás.com: Theaters of Mexico City''] The theater was inaugurated on January 1, 1899. It is said that the inauguration was attended by the then President of Mexico [[Porfirio Díaz]]. But in 1906, the theater is acquired by businessman Francisco Cardona, who decides to rename it with the name of his wife, legendary Mexican actress and theater entrepreneur [[Virginia Fábregas]]. At that time was a novelty, since it was the first theater in the Mexican capital to own electric lighting.[http://enteratedf.com/lugar/teatro-fru-fru ''EnterateDF.com: The Teatro Fru Fru''] The theater lived a period of splendor at the beginning of the century. But in 1933, the theater began to lose its splendor and changed its name to Teatro Mexicano.[http://www.escenalatina.com/2016/09/hablemos-del-teatro-fru-fru/ ''Escenalatina.com: About the Teatro Fru Fru''] However, due to unknown issues, the theater remained closed for several years and was about to be demolished. In 1973, the theater was acquired and remodeled by Mexican actress and singer [[Irma Serrano]] ''La Tigresa''. The actress claims to have acquired the property at an auction of the cement company Anahuac.[http://www.jornada.unam.mx/2001/12/17/12an1esp.html ''JornadaUNAM.mx: Reopening of the Fru Fru''] With an important investment, Serrano reactive the theater baptizing it with the present name. The theater was inaugurated with the controversial theatrical assembly ''Naná'', based on the [[Nana (novel)|homonymous novel]] of [[Emile Zola]], and produced and carried out by Serrano. The work remained on the billboard with great success for a couple of years. From that moment, the theater becomes the forum for a series of controversial works produced and some also starring by ''La Tigresa''. Among them stand out montages like ''Lucrecia Borgia'' (1977) or ''Yocasta Reina'' (1978), among others. In the early 1980s, the theater introduced the concept known as ''Midnight Theater'', created by producer and director Pablo Leder, which was based on works aimed at a strictly adult audience.[http://xn--salvadornuez-jhb.com/curiosidades/pablo-leder-y-mexico-gay-de-1960-1970-hubo-una-vez-antes-del-sida/ ''SalvadorNuñez.com: Pablo Leder''] This situation gave the theater a reputation of controversial and transgressor, although the theatrical montages stood out by a great quality in production. At the end of 1980s, the theater gradually stopped performing plays. During 1990s, the venue opened its doors for certain seasons as a night club. In 2003, the theater reopens its doors to being rented by Serrano to the entrepreneur Enrique Vidal.[http://archivo.eluniversal.com.mx/espectaculos/46915.html ''ElUniversal.com: Reopening of the Teatro Fru Fru''] However, after a series of conflicts, the enclosure closed its doors for the second time. Since then, the venue has reopened its doors for theatrical productions sporadically. In recent times the venue has also served as a space for musical events by bands and artists such as Victimas del Doctor Cerebro,[http://www.bizarro.fm/2016/10/victimas-dr-cerebro-teatro-fru-fru/ ''Bizarro.fm: Víctimas del Doctor Cerebro in the Fru Fru''] [[Natalia Lafourcade]].[https://soundcheck.com.mx/natalia-lafourcade-visita-el-teatro-fru-fru/ ''SoundCheck.com: Lafourcade visits the Fru Fru''] [[Gang Gang Dance]][http://www.chilango.com/musica/concierto/2011/09/30/gang-gang-dance-en-mexico ''Chilango.com: Gang Gang Dance in Mexico''] and [[The Dresden Dolls]].[http://rollingstone.com.mx/tag/the-dresden-dolls-en-el-teatro-fru-fru/ ''Rolling Stone Mexico: The Dresden Dolls in Mexico''] Due to its history and peculiar decorative style, the Teatro Fru Fru has also served as a space for the recording of music videos and films both national and foreign. Among them are ''[[Cantinflas (film)|Cantinflas]]'' (2014) by Sebastián del Amo and ''[[Spectre (2015 film)|Spectre]]'' (2015), by [[Sam Mendes]].[http://www.elproyectormx.com/2015/08/teatro-fru-fru-el-nuevo-lugar-in-para.html ''El Proyectormx.com: The Teatro Fru Fru, the New "in" place to film in Mexico City''] ==Legends== * In one of the galleries of the precinct existed in the years 1970's and 1980's a cabaret known as ''La Cueva de La Tigresa'', famous for its daring [[burlesque]] shows. * In the lobby there is a statue of what appears to be a demon carrying a small tray. According to tradition, the actors must leave a sweet as an offering so that their works do not fail.[https://www.maspormas.com/2017/01/26/habitantes-teatro-fru-fru/ ''Máspormás.com: Habitantes del… Teatro Fru Fru''] * Due to its antiquity, peculiar architecture and decoration and controversial personality of Irma Serrano, its owner, has been the subject of numerous legends and myths that relate paranormal events inside its doors.[http://mitosmonstruosyleyendas.blogspot.mx/2015/12/fantasmas-de-la-ciudad-de-mexico.html ''Monstruos y leyendas blog: Ghosts in Mexico City''] ==See also== *[[Teatro de la Ciudad]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.chilango.com/musica/centro-historico/teatro-fru-fru ''Teatro Fru Fru in Chilango.com''] * [https://www.timeoutmexico.mx/ciudad-de-mexico/teatro/teatro-fru-fru ''TimeOutMexico: Teatro Fru Fru''] *[https://www.facebook.com/pages/Teatro-Fru-Fru/215265188488364 ''Official Facebook''] {{Historic buildings of Mexico City Centro}} {{Cuauhtémoc, Mexico City}} [[Category:Buildings and structures in Mexico City]] [[Category:Theatres in Mexico City]] [[Category:Cuauhtémoc, Mexico City]] [[Category:Historic center of Mexico City]] [[Category:1899 establishments in Mexico]] [[Category:Theatres completed in 1899]] [[Category:20th century in Mexico City]] [[Category:Second Empire architecture]] [[Category:Neoclassical architecture in Mexico]]

{{Orphan|date=December 2016}} [[File:Affymetrix-microarray.jpg|thumb|[[DNA microarray]] used to analyze the expression of human genes left mouse right.]] The '''thanatotranscriptome''' denotes (in the fields of [[biochemistry]], [[microbiology]] and [[biophysics]] of [[thanatology]] and in particular [[forensic]]) all [[ribonucleic acid|RNA]] from the transcript of the part of [[genome]] still active or awakened in the internal organs of a dead body for 24 to 48 hours following the time of the [[death]].Pozhitkov, A. E., Neme, R., Domazet-Loso, T., Leroux, B., Soni, S., Tautz, D., & Noble, P. A. (2016). Thanatotranscriptome: genes actively expressed after organismal death. bioRxiv, 058305.{{,}}Javan, G. T., Can, I., Finley, S. J., & Soni, S. (2015). The apoptotic thanatotranscriptome associated with the liver of cadavers. Forensic science, medicine, and pathology, 11(4), 509-516 ([https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s12024-015-9704-6 summary]). (It was recently showed that in these 48 hours, some genes continue to be expressed in [[cell (biology)|cell]]s, producing the [[mRNA]] and that certain genes are expressed again that had been inhibited since the end of fetal development) == Thanatotranscriptomic Analysis == It can from a [[serology]] postmortem characterize [[transcriptome]] of [[tissue (biology)|tissue]] particular cell type, or compare the transcriptomes between various conditions experimental. It can be complementary to the analysis of [[thanatomicrobiome]] to better understand the process of transformation of the [[necromass]] in the days following the death;.Javan, G. T., Finley, S. J., Abidin, Z., & Mulle, J. G. (2016) ''[https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4764706/ The Thanatomicrobiome: A Missing Piece of the Microbial Puzzle of Death]''. Frontiers in microbiology, 7 Characterization and quantification of the transcriptome in a tissue "dead" given and conditions data can identify [[gene]]s assets, to determine the regulatory mechanisms of [[Gene Expression]] and set networks of gene expression. == Analytical Techniques == The techniques commonly used for simultaneously measuring the concentration of a large number of different types of mRNA include [[biochip|Microarray]], high throughput sequencing said RNA [[RNA-Seq]]. == Scientific History == Clues to the existence of a post-mortem transcriptome existed at least since the beginning of the 21st century,Javan, G. T., Can, I., Finley, S. J., & Soni, S. (2015). ''The apoptotic thanatotranscriptome associated with the liver of cadavers''. Forensic science, medicine, and pathology, 11(4), 509-516. but in [[scientific publications]] the word ''thanatotranscriptome'' seems to have been first proposed by Javan et al. in 2015;Javan, G. T., Kwon, I., Finley, S. J., & Lee, Y. (2015). ''[https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Sheree_Finley/publication/284233163_Progression_of_Thanatophagy_in_Cadaver_Brain_and_Heart_Tissues/links/567aa20308ae1e63f1df4dc3.pdf Biochemistry and Biophysics Reports].'' At the [[University of Washington]], Peter Noble, Alex Pozhitkov and their colleagues recently (2016) confirmed that up to 2 days (48 hours) after the death of mice or zebrafish, many genes still function in their [[Human body|body]].Williams, Anna (2016) “[https://www.newscientist.com/article/2094644-hundreds-of-genes-seen-sparking-to-life-two-days-after-death/ ''Hundreds of genes seen sparking to life two days after death (The discovery that many genes are still working up to 48 hours after death has implications for organ transplants, forensics and our very definition of death)'']”; New Scientist, 21 juin 2016, commentant un article intitulé “''Genes get active after death''” dont la référence est BioRxiv, DOI: 10.1101/058305; DOI: 10.1101/058370
changes in the quantities of [[mRNA]] in the body prove that hundreds of genes with very different functions awoke just after death 548 genes have thus awakened after the death of [[zebrafish]] and 515 in the [[laboratory mice]]. Among the genes which thus awake, there are genes involved in the development of the organism, including genes that are normally activated only ''[[in utero]]'' or ''[[in ovo]]'' (in the egg) during fetal development. == Applications == This information could possibly in the future lead to: * Construct a definition both more accurate and nuanced phenomenon of "[[death]]"; * More precise time of death by the [[forensic]] (or a biologist or veterinarian in an [[EcoHealth]] investigation who needs information on hours or causes of poisoning, without the case of a [[zoonosis]] for example.
We are far, but if we come to better understand the steps of this phenomenon in the [[Human]], a coroner could via a ''"postmortem serology"''Moreno, L. I., Tate, C. M., Knott, E. L., McDaniel, J. E., Rogers, S. S., Koons, B. W., ... & Robertson, J. M. (2012). Determination of an effective housekeeping gene for the quantification of mRNA for forensic applications. Journal of Forensic Sciences, 57(4), 1051-1058 ([http://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1111/j.1556-4029.2012.02086.x/full summary]). perhaps in the future, according to the dosage of the mRNA, establish with greater precision the time since death (by hour, even in minutes rather than days, which can be useful for investigations to reconstruct the conditions of death). * Illuminate the phenomenon of [[cell death]] of [[apoptosis]] or the death of a body, and in particular the phenomenon of [[ischemia]] ([[myocardial]] including) and its process [[healing]] or resilience, for perhaps then to facilitate them.
This gene revival also means remaining in the cells for up to 48 hours after the death of these animals enough energy for activating the cellular machinery. At least part of these genes appear to be genes involved in physiological healing, healing or "auto-resuscitation". * Understand cancer. It was found that among the genes reactivated soon after death, some of the genes involved in the process of [[cancerous]] (reactivated with a peak of activity reaches about 24 hours after death) ; detailed understanding of this phenomenon could shed light on the phenomenon of carcinogenesis and maybe bring some new elements to better combat. * Improving the quality of organ transplants. Indeed, the fact that cancer-related genes are activated after the death in animals is information that leads us to consider the time of organ transplantation to reduce the incidence of cancer in people receiving these transplants. Persons to which was grafted a new liver actually more cancers after treatment than would be statistically normal. This phenomenon was attributed to the diet imposed on them, or immunosuppressive drugs they receive for their body does not reject the transplant. One hypothesis (yet to be verified) is that the cancer genes activated in the [[liver]] of the [[organ donation|donor]] may also play a role. * Whether there is the same in humans, because previous studies have already shown that in people dead by trauma, heart attack or suffocation, various genes including those involved in cardiac muscle contraction and wound healing, were active more than 12 hours after death.González-Herrera, L., Valenzuela, A., Marchal, J. A., Lorente, J. A., & Villanueva, E. (2013). Studies on RNA integrity and gene expression in human myocardial tissue, pericardial fluid and blood, and its postmortem stability. Forensic science international, 232(1), 218-228 ([http://www.fsijournal.org/article/S0379-0738(13)00378-2/abstract summary]). Similarly for gene dental pulp.Poór, V. S., Lukács, D., Nagy, T., Rácz, E., & Sipos, K. (2016). The rate of RNA degradation in human dental pulp reveals post-mortem interval. International journal of legal medicine, 130(3), 615-619 ([https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s00414-015-1295-y summary]). Some authors in 2015 introduced the concept of ''"thanatotranscriptome [[apoptosis|apoptotic]]"''Javan, G. T., Can, I., Finley, S. J., & Soni, S. (2015). The apoptotic thanatotranscriptome associated with the liver of cadavers. Forensic science, medicine, and pathology, 11(4), 509-516 ([https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s12024-015-9704-6 summary]. * Test another hypothesis is that after death, a rapid decrease of the "suppressor genes" activity (which normally inhibit the activation of other genes, including those no longer needed after the fetal stage) would allow dormant genes wake up, at least for this short period of time. == See also == {{Portal|Molecular and cellular biology|death}} {{div col|colwidth=18em}} * [[Molecular biology]] * [[Bioinformatics]] * [[Genevestigator]] {{div col end}} == References == {{Genomics}} [[Category:Cell biology]] [[Category:Genomics]] [[Category:Biophysics]] [[Category:Genetics]] [[Category:Biochemistry]] [[Category:Microbiology]] [[Category:Death]]

{{use mdy dates|date=April 2018}} {{Donald Trump series}} The following is a [[timeline of the presidency of Donald Trump]] during the second quarter of 2018. To navigate among quarters, see [[Timeline of the presidency of Donald Trump]]. ==Overview== ===Economy=== Over 103,000 jobs were created in March as the unemployment rate remained stable into April. At the start of the quarter, the US stock market experienced daily sell-offs and recoveries due to a burgeoning US-China trade war and increased political scrutiny of American business icons [[Amazon (company)|Amazon]] and [[Facebook]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Iyengar|first1=Rishi|title=How a US-China trade war could hurt (and help) others|url=http://money.cnn.com/2018/04/10/news/economy/us-china-trade-war-fallout-countries/index.html|accessdate=April 24, 2018|publisher=CNN Money|date=April 10, 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Helmore|first1=Edward|title=Trouble for big tech as consumers sour on Amazon, Facebook and co|url=https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2018/apr/01/big-tech-touble-amazon-facebook|accessdate=April 24, 2018|publisher=The Guardian|date=April 1, 2018}}</ref> In May, the [[United States Department of Labor|U.S. Labor Department]] reported a seasonally adjusted unemployment rate of 3.9% for April and an increase of 164,000 jobs. Wages grew by 2.6%. Hiring gains were broad based with jobs being added in the fields of professional and business services, health care, manufacturing, and mining.<ref>{{cite web|title=THE EMPLOYMENT SITUATION — APRIL 2018|url=https://www.bls.gov/news.release/pdf/empsit.pdf|website=www.bls.gov|publisher=US Department of Labor, Bureau of Labor Statistics|accessdate=May 6, 2018}}</ref>
=== Public opinion === According to [[FiveThirtyEight]], President Trump's approval rate at the beginning of this quarter was 40.5%, down 4.9% from the start of his presidency.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/trump-approval-ratings |title=How unpopular is Donald Trump? |website=projects.fivethirtyeight.com |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170616000621/https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/trump-approval-ratings/ |archivedate=June 16, 2017 |df=mdy-all}}</ref> By May 1, it had improved to 41.2%.
==Timeline== === April 2018 ===
{| class="wikitable" |- ! Date ! Events ! Photos |- style="background:white;" | colspan=3 | ==== Week 63 ==== |- |Monday, '''April 2''' | *President Trump and first lady Melania host the 140th annual White House Easter Egg Roll.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Dvorak|first1=Petula|title=‘This isn’t about politics’: At Trump’s first Easter Egg Roll, a welcome spirit of civility|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/local/this-isnt-about-politics-at-trumps-first-easter-egg-roll-a-welcome-spirit-of-civility/2017/04/17/c9825b80-23a3-11e7-b503-9d616bd5a305_story.html?noredirect=on|website=www.washingtonpost.com|publisher=''Washington Post''|accessdate=April 10, 2018}}</ref> *Kremlin foreign policy aide [[Yuri Ushakov]] claims Trump invited Russian President Putin to the White House.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Thomas|first1=Ken|title=President Trump Invites Vladimir Putin to the White House, Kremlin Says|url=http://time.com/5224577/donald-trump-vladimir-putin-white-house-invite/|website=time.com|publisher=''Time''|accessdate=April 10, 2018}}</ref>
|

==== Week 64 ====
|- |Monday, '''April 9''' | *After the [[FBI]] and federal prosecutors raid the home, hotel room, and office of President Trump's personal attorney, [[Michael Cohen (lawyer)|Michael Cohen]], Trump brands the raid as "an attack on our country in a true sense".<ref>{{cite web|last1=Salama|first1=Vivian|last2=Jackson|first2=Hallie|last3=Welker|first3=Kristen|title=Trump calls FBI raid on his lawyer's office 'an attack on our country'|url=https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/politics-news/trump-calls-fbi-raid-his-lawyer-s-office-attack-our-n864186|publisher=[[NBC News]]|accessdate=April 10, 2018}}</ref> *Regarding firing special counsel [[Robert Mueller]], President Trump says, "Many people have said you should fire him", and "We'll see what happens".<ref>{{cite web|last1=Diamond|first1=Jeremy|title=Trump slams FBI for raid of his personal attorney's office|url=https://edition.cnn.com/2018/04/09/politics/donald-trump-fbi-michael-cohen/index.html|publisher=CNN|accessdate=April 10, 2018}}</ref> *President Trump meets with military leaders and generals to discuss a response to [[2018 Douma chemical attack|poison gas attacks]] in [[Syria]].<ref>{{cite web|last1=Jacobs|first1=Jennifer|title=Trump Says U.S. Will Respond to Syria Attack ‘Forcefully’|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-04-09/trump-national-security-advisers-are-said-to-meet-on-syria|website=www.bloomberg.com/news|publisher=Bloomberg|accessdate=April 10, 2018}}</ref> |
|- | Tuesday, '''April 10''' | *The White House confirms the resignation of Homeland Security advisor [[Thomas Bossert]] and National Security Council spokesman [[Michael Anton]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Trump's homeland security adviser Tom Bossert resigns|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-us-canada-43706881|website=www.bbc.com|publisher=BBC|accessdate=April 10, 2018}}</ref> *President Trump hosts [[Tamim bin Hamad Al Thani]], the Emir of the State of [[Qatar]], for a friendly visit at the White House.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Baker|first1=Peter|title=Trump now sees Qatar as an ally against terrorism|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2018/04/10/world/middleeast/trump-qatar-terrorism.html|website=www.nytimes.com|publisher=''The New York Times''|accessdate=April 11, 2018}}</ref> *President Trump hosts the [[NCAA]] football champion [[Alabama Crimson Tide]] on the south lawn of the White House.<ref>{{cite web|last1=West|first1=Jenna|title=Alabama's Football Team Visits the White House to Celebrate Their National Championship Win|url=https://www.si.com/college-football/2018/04/10/alabama-football-team-visits-white-house|website=www.si.com|publisher=''Sports Illustrated''|accessdate=April 13, 2018}}</ref>
|
|- | Wednesday, '''April 11''' | *President Trump signs a sex trafficking bill that reduces legal protections for websites that enable sex trafficking.<ref>{{cite web|title=Trump signs online sex trafficking bill|url=https://www.cbsnews.com/news/trump-signs-online-sex-trafficking-bill-live-updates/|website=www.cbsnews.com|publisher=CBS News|accessdate=April 11, 2018}}</ref> *[[Nadia Schadlow]], deputy national security adviser for strategy, resigns effective April 27, 2018.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Epstein|first1=Jennifer|last2=Wadhams|first2=Nick|title=Trump Deputy National Security Adviser Nadia Schadlow Resigns|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-04-11/trump-deputy-national-security-adviser-schadlow-resigns|website=www.bloomberg.com|publisher=Bloomberg|accessdate=April 12, 2018}}</ref> *President Trump hires a new member for his legal team, [[Joanna Hendon]], a partner at the New York firm Spears & Imes.<ref>{{cite news|title=Trump lawyer Michael Cohen under criminal investigation|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-us-canada-43761555|accessdate=April 17, 2018|publisher=BBC|date=April 13, 2018}}</ref> |
|- | Thursday, '''April 12''' | *President Trump launches a task force to "conduct a thorough evaluation of the operations and finances of the United States Postal System".<ref>{{cite web|last1=Samuels|first1=Brett|title=Trump launches task force to evaluate Postal Service operations|url=http://thehill.com/homenews/administration/382961-trump-announces-task-force-to-evaluate-operations-of-postal-service|website=thehill.com|publisher=''The Hill''|accessdate=April 13, 2018}}</ref> *President Trump tweets a warning that "an attack on Syria could be very soon or not soon at all!" <ref>{{cite web|title=After warning Russia, Trump tweets on possible Syria strike timing|url=https://www.cbsnews.com/news/donald-trump-russia-chemical-attack-us-syria-strike-soon-or-not-soon-at-all/|website=www.cbsnews.com|publisher=CBS News|accessdate=April 13, 2018}}</ref>
|
|- | Friday, '''April 13''' | *President Trump pardons [[Scooter Libby]], the former chief of staff for Vice President [[Dick Cheney]] in the [[Presidency of George W. Bush|George W. Bush Administration]]. As a result of the Plame investigation into [[Plame affair grand jury investigation|the leaking of an undercover CIA agent's identity]], Libby had been found guilty of [[making false statements]], [[obstruction of justice]] and [[lying under oath]].<ref>{{cite web|last1=Watson|first1=Kathryn|title=Trump pardons "Scooter" Libby, former adviser to Dick Cheney|url=https://www.cbsnews.com/news/trump-pardons-scooter-libby-former-adviser-to-dick-cheney/|website=www.cbsnews.com|publisher=CBS News|accessdate=April 13, 2018}}</ref> *President Trump sends a series of tweets attacking James Comey, the fired FBI director, as a liar and a “slimeball” and suggests Comey should be in jail.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Le Miere|first1=Jason|title=Trump pardons Scooter Libby, who was convicted of lying about leak, on same day he blasts Comey as ‘leaker’ and ‘liar’|url=http://www.newsweek.com/trump-pardon-scooter-libby-comey-885780|publisher=''[[Newsweek]]''|accessdate=April 14, 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last1=Rozsa|first1=Matthew|title=While Trump blasts “leaker” James Comey, he wants to pardon leaker Scooter Libby|url=https://www.salon.com/2018/04/13/while-trump-blasts-leaker-james-comey-he-wants-to-pardon-leaker-scooter-libby/|work=[[Salon and challenges Iran and Russia to decide if they will continue to support the Assad regime.<ref>{{cite web|title=Trump announces "precision" strike on Syria's chemical weapons capabilities 2018}}</ref> *President Trump says the United States may rejoin the [[Trans-Pacific Partnership]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/business-43747211|title=Trump to reconsider TPP trade pact|date=April 13, 2018|publisher=|via=www.bbc.com}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.news.com.au/finance/donald-trump-considers-major-tpp-backflip-considers-rejoining-the-trans-pacific-partnership/news-story/75cb5a67d7e069e9af2869282758a962|title=Trump mulls major TPP backflip|website=news.com.au}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.abc.net.au/news/2018-04-13/donald-trump-reportedly-exploring-rejoining-tpp-trade-deal-talks/9652202|title=Australian farmers shocked but cautious about news Trump wants 'another look' at the TPP|date=April 13, 2018|website=abc.net.au}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.cnbc.com/2018/04/13/elizabeth-warren-bernie-sanders-slam-trumps-move-on-tpp-trade-deal.html|title='A ridiculous reversal': Top Democrats who sided with Trump on trade slam TPP move|first=Jacob|last=Pramuk|date=April 13, 2018|website=cnbc.com}}</ref> |[[File:President Trump Delivers an Address to the Nation.webm|thumb|center|upright=0.8|President Trump announces Syrian missile strikes]]
|- style="background:white;" | colspan="3" |
====Week 65====
